meanings.def: used when referring to people, animals or things as the object of a verb or preposition, or after the verb be
examples: What are you doing with those matches? Give them to me.
Did you eat all of them?

meanings.def: used instead of him or her to refer to a person whose sex is not mentioned or not known
examples: If anyone comes in before I get back, ask them to wait.

related: if you can’t beat them, join them
take somebody as you find them
good for you, somebody, them, etc.
when you’ve seen, heard, etc. one, you’ve seen, heard, etc. them all
